result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jyorel M Ware

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jyorel M Ware not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court for Jyorel M Ware.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Michael R Staskunas for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jyorel M Ware in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Defendant Jyorel M Ware in custody. Not produced, appearance waived. Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Cash Bond remains as previously set. All conditions remain the same. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests scheduling conference date.   Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jyorel M Ware in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Defendant Jyorel M Ware in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Jyorel M Ware appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective J. Rydzewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11. Bail Bond Hearing to be heard by Judge Franke for Br. 11.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court, appear by video. Defendant Jyorel M Ware not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness unable to appear due to vacation this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brown Deer Liquor at 8564 West Brown Deer Road, Milwaukee, WI and Eric Parr (Co-defendant)

Defendant Jyorel M Ware in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Jyorel M Ware in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jyorel M Ware appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
